CollaborationType.name: Bilateral
CollaborationType.description: Bilateral transactions are those undertaken by a donor, excluding core contributions to other organisations (codes 2 and 3 below). It includes transactions channelled through other organisations.

CollaborationType.name: Multilateral
CollaborationType.description: Multilateral contributions are those made to a recipient institution which: i. conducts all or part of its activities in favour of development; ii. is an international agency, institution or organisation whose members are governments, or a fund managed autonomously by such an agency; and iii. pools contributions so that they lose their identity and become an integral part of its financial assets.

CollaborationType.name: Bilateral, core contributions to NGOs and other private bodies / PPPs
CollaborationType.description: Bilateral funds paid over to national and international non-governmental organisations (NGOs), Public Private Partnerships (PPPs), or other private bodies for use at their discretion.

CollaborationType.name: Multilateral outflows
CollaborationType.description: Aid activities financed from the multilateral institutions' regular budgets.

CollaborationType.name: Bilateral, ex-post reporting on NGOs' activities funded through core contributions
